reuo.resources

Class Bitmap

  • java.lang.Object
    • reuo.resources.Bitmap
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LightMap

    public class Bitmap
extends Object
    An image that is represented with an underlying Buffer that holds the data.

    Insets

    To conserve memory Bitmaps may have padding on all four sides. However, getInsets() may return null if there is no padding. The dimensions of the Bitmap with padding is given by getWidth() and getHeight(), while the dimensions of the actual image that is stored are given by getImageHeight() and getImageWidth(). A Bitmap may entirely be padding if it contains no image data and only padding, in which case isEmpty() will return true.

    Data Formats

    The pixel format of a Bitmap is implied by the type of Buffer that is returned by getData(). This Buffer may be:
    • ShortBuffer: 16-bit per pixel. Typically 5 bits per component with 1 bit for alpha.
    • ByteBuffer: These pixels are indexed with a Palette.
    Author:
    Kristopher Ives
